name: Data Warehouse Architect
description: Responsibilities:  Leading the architecture and development of the new Data Warehouse / BI platform for a large enterprise customers (Fortune Global 500); Translate business requirements into development of logical and physical design, ETL development; Develop the processes to ensure security, integrity and quality of the data in the Data Warehouse to act as a “Source of Truth”; Ensure architecture and development standards, methodologies and best practices are followed through all the phases of DWH/BI lifecycle; Lead the technical team providing guidance on implementing the architecture approach / troubleshooting; Develop architecture design and technical specifications, present the technical approach to the team and stakeholders.  Required competencies:  5+ experience in doing Data Architecture for BI and Analytics; Expertise in relational databases, such as SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL etc. (one or more from the list); Strong SQL and data modeling knowledge; Proven track record of implementing end-to-end BI/Analytics solutions; Hands-on experience with all the parts of DWH lifecycle, including data analysis, profiling, data mart modeling, ETL design; Expertise in BI and visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI etc.; Experience in configuring and tuning enterprise databases and data access; Experience defining and implementing team/company -wide formal standards and guidelines for database design using industry-standard best practices; Experience and deep understanding of one or more of the DWH design methodologies, such as CIF, Dimensional Modeling or Data Vault; Experience in automating ETL batch workload, hands-on experience with open-source and commercial ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Airflow etc.); Experience writing high-quality technical documentation, presenting technical architecture to the team / stakeholders; Experience with cloud DWaaS platforms (Snowflake, RedShift, Azure SQL DWH) would be a strong plus; Experience with Data lake solutions (Hadoop, AWS, Azure) would be a strong plus; Upper-intermediate English  We can offer:  Working in a world’s leading software engineering company according to Forrester, Deloitte, and IAOP; Projects for such clients as PayPal, Wargaming, Xerox, Philips, adidas and Toyota; Opportunity to work on leading-edge platforms and technologies; Competitive compensation that depends on your qualification and skills; Regular performance feedback and salary reviews; Flexible working hours aligned to your schedule. Business trips to USA
responsibility: Leading the architecture and development of the new Data Warehouse / BI platform for a large enterprise customers (Fortune Global 500).
